message.content:
cs.CR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV 

The paper deals with the problem of text steganography, which is a subfield of cybersecurity. Therefore, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category. The proposed method involves the use of Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques, such as LSTM and CNN, to analyze the semantic and contextual features of the text. Hence, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is also a likely category. The use of attention mechanism and softmax layer for classification suggests the involvement of machine learning techniques, which can be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves the use of CNN for feature extraction, which falls under cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the use of NLP techniques such as word embeddings and LSTM suggests the involvement of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
